files.name: spaceone/api/notification/v1/user_channel.proto
files.description: A UserChannel is a destination where Notifications are delivered. Notifications are generated via the Protocol set by each User.

fields.name: protocol_id
fields.description: The ID of protocol that will be set in user channel.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of User Channel. It can have a maximum of 255 characters.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
The data for using user channel.
This data is encrypted and stored in the Secret service if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to SECRET type.
In this case, the secret ID that is stored in the security service will be returned and the data value will be empty.
if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to PLAIN_TEXT type, This data is not encrypted and stored directly in the DB.

fields.name: is_subscribe
fields.description:
Indicates whether subscriptions will be used.
+optional

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description:
When using subscriptions, it indicates the topic list to subscription.
If is_subscribe is set to false, this value is ignored.
+optional
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: is_scheduled
fields.description:
Indicates whether schedule will be used.
+optional

fields.name: schedule
fields.description:
Schedule for which you want to receive notifications through the user channel.
+optional

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
The tags for user channel.
+optional

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The ID of user

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.name: user_channel_id
fields.description: The ID of user channel.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.name: only
fields.description:
The list of the user channel information column you want to be returned. It must be specified in the UserChannelInfo.
+optional
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: user_channel_id
fields.description: The ID of user channel.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of user channel. It can have a maximum of 255 characters.
+optional

fields.name: data
fields.description:
The data for using user channel.
This data is encrypted and stored in the Secret service if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to SECRET type.
In this case, the secret ID that is stored in the security service will be returned and the data value will be empty.
if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to PLAIN_TEXT type, This data is not encrypted and stored directly in the DB.
+optional

fields.name: schedule
fields.description:
Set the level of notification.
If a notification has a level and a notification level that this channel can receive is set, a notification is dispatched only if the notification level is the same.
+optional

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
The tags for user channel.
+optional

fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.description: The ID of user channel.

If is_subscribe is set to false, this value is ignored.

fields.name: day_of_week
fields.description:
Day of the week to be notified.
As a list type, only types that can be specified from MON to SUN can be set.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: start_hour
fields.description:
Start time to receive notifications.
Only integer type can be set, and 0 to 23 can be.

fields.name: end_hour
fields.description:
End time to receive notifications.
Only integer type can be set, and 1 to 24 can be.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Statistics Query format provided by SpaceONE. Please check the link for more information.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.name: results
fields.description: List of queried user channels.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total counts of queried user channels.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new UserChannel. A UserChannel is a channel that delivers a Notification to users when the Notification is created. When creating a UserChannel, one Protocol must be selected, and an Notification is dispatched via the selected Protocol.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates a specific UserChannel. A UserChannel that has already been configured cannot be changed. Instead, the data required for dispatching Notifications to a UserChannel can be updated.

methods.name: set_schedule
methods.description: Sets a schedule for a UserChannel. A schedule defines the time to receive a Notification. When a Notification is created, you can set the day of the week and time you want to receive it. When you set the day of the week, you can receive a notification only on the day of the week you set. If you also set the start time and end time with the day of the week, you can receive a Notification only at the scheduled time on the day of the week you set. If there is no schedule set in a UserChannel, Notifications will be dispatched at all times via the UserChannel.

methods.name: set_subscription
methods.description: Sets a subscription for a UserChannel. A subscription is a topic for channels to subscribe to and get notified about. If a UserChannel has subscriptions, a Notification is dispatched only if the topic of the Notification is the same as the one set in the subscriptions. If there is no subscription in a UserChannel, all Notifications will be dispatched.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Enables a specific UserChannel. If a UserChannel is enabled, the UserChannel can be used and the Notification can be dispatched. Even if a UserChannel is enabled, if the Protocol used in the UserChannel is disabled, the Notification is not dispatched.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Disables a specific UserChannel. If a UserChannel is disabled, the Notification is not dispatched, even if it is created.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a specific UserChannel. You must specify the `user_channel_id` of the UserChannel to delete.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets a specific UserChannel. Prints detailed information about the UserChannel, including the Protocol configured and the Notification settings.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Gets a list of all UserChannels. You can use a query to get a filtered list of UserChannels.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
